Posts.Content: nikkidurepo wrote: hi every body! i was breastfeeding my 4 month old until i was diagnosed on dec 2. i've since stopped cold turkey. i had my lumpectomy with sentinel node biopsy on dec 18 and then had a lymph node dissection on dec 26. i've noticed that i had a substantial amount of swelling and bruising to my left breast and i had tons of pain. my surgical wound has been bleeding with old blood since jan 5 and i've gotten mod relief from pain. the pain under my left arm is still pretty high. my surgeon said that my breasts are very vascular due to the breastfeeding.....is there anyone out there with a similar situation? thanks! nikki Dx 12/2/2008, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/13 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: recent breastfeeding and surgery nikkidurepo nikkidurepo

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2009 02:28AM nikkidurepo wrote: hi lisalisa!! i would have LOVED to meet you on the strand this friday...we're going on a desert camping trip this weekend, but please let me know when you'll be there again.....i haven't really been out and about since my surgeries, but the weather has been so nice, it would be great to start doing walks out on the strand again. i'm being treated through breastlink...their office is in manhattan beach (it's really on the hawthorne side on aviation near rosecrans, but they call it their manhattan beach office!) that's where i'll be getting my chemo, ,which will start next week. thanks for inviting to the group...hope to meet up with you soon!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed 3 months after giving birth to my second child kelty kelty

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2009 03:07PM nikkidurepo wrote: lisa hugs1!!!! thank you for sharing your amazing story, i am so touched and inspired. thank you so much! i start chemo on jan 26-i'm so scared about being sooooo tired that i can't take care of my baby and also losing my hair (i'm scared that my little one won't recognize me-silly, i know!) my chemo is cytoxan and taxotere x6 treatments. i went back to the surgeon 2 days ago-a wound opened up beneath my breast and it wouldn't stop bleeding after 10 days already-the doc explained that because my tumor was a little large(3cm) and very deep (my doc nor i could never "feel" a lump) i'm normally a size b/c but because i was breastfeeding i was a EE. anyways, the "void" left in my breast allowed the surrounding tissues to accumulate fluid (blood) and it needed somewhere to go-so that's why we weren't alarmed when i started bleeding from my surgical site 10 days ago-the swelling and pain to my left breast became so much better, but the bleeding was getting on my nerves- so my doc put a couple of stitches, and now no more bleeding---ya hoo!!!!! our little family is getting ready to go to the desert to go rv camping-a lot of our friends will meet us there-it's kind of my last hoorah until chemo starts-so i'm looking to this! all the women on this board have beautiful spirits! thank you!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed 3 months after giving birth to my second child kelty kelty

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2009 02:13AM nikkidurepo wrote: hello ladies! i've been away from the board a while-i just thought i update you all- i started chemo (cytoxan and taxotere) on 1/26-i felt queasy and a little tired, and i had some itching to my legs-but that was the worse of it---i've been walking with my baby and dog everyday. i cut my hair (10 inches) and donated to locks of love--i found a really cute wig, and now i'm looking for cute hats! my baby has discovered her feet-its so fun watching her grab them!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed 3 months after giving birth to my second child kelty kelty

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2009 01:38PM nikkidurepo wrote: hi kelty!  i saw your reply on my post just know... i am soooo sorry that this is happening to you. it can be all so overwhelming and i agree with you...breastfeeding and finding out you have breast cancer really really sucks!!! fortunately riley (my baby girl) adjusted fine to formula bottle feeding, but going cold turkey from breastfeeding was difficult. i'm still recovering from my lumpectomy and lymph node dissection. my surgeon said that there was a lot of bleeding during my surgery because my breasts are so vascular from lactating and all. i'm so sorry that you have to get a masectomy....how are you doing? the hardest thing for me right now is not being able to carry riley.... again i am so sorry that this is happening to you, but i'm glad that we were able to find each other. there isn't too many of us out there. so if it's ok with you, i would like us to stay in touch and keep each other updated with everything. does your 3 yr old understand what's going on? i do hope you have a strong support system at home..... give your babies a million kisses.... hope to hear from you soon...nikki
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed 3 months after giving birth to my second child kelty kelty

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2009 02:13AM nikkidurepo wrote: i'm so glad for you and your daughter.....thank goodness for wonderful teachers!!!! when i was first diagnosed (and i'm almost positive that you thought the same way) the first thing i thought of was my child.....i tear up everytime i think about it....i only can imagine what it must be like to have a newborn and a toddler and dealing with breast cancer...it must be so difficult and mind boggling in your head....but please please try to be positive and be happy that you have your 2 little angels to help through this terrible ordeal...ok?.... my husband and i had some difficulty getting pregnant with riley....but she's perfect! i really wanted to try for a 2nd baby in march.....when my oncologist explained what chemo and hormone therapy will do to my eggs, he told me to look into embryonic freezing....well, it's a fantastic idea, but it's a lot of money for something that's not a guarantee....so, we're possibly looking at adoption...........my heart was so set on being pregnant again...i'm obviously still trying to be at peace with this....hopefully staying in touch with you will help.... kiss your babies!!!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed 3 months after giving birth to my second child kelty kelty
